heading: One Shot Rogue Build Guide
content: Welcome to the ! The purpose of this build is to one-shot every Boss in the game, including Uber and Tormented Bosses! This build excels at that, but should not be used outside of that. So if you like a big Kamehame-Ha using , this is the build for you. The Gear, Skills, Paragon Board, "Seasonal Content" and Gameplay setup are unique to this build and require a strong understanding of the class to pilot it properly! Look below for the selected , Paragon point allocation, and the correct you should use for the One Shot Rogue. In Season 4, the Season Theme revolves around helping out the . Compared to past themes, this one does not offer any borrowed power as the entire game has been redesigned with new itemization and crafting options, increasing player power substantially across the board. Instead, you can gather reputation similar to the Vampire Bounty Board from Season 2 to unlock rewards that supercharge your leveling journey to 100 with extra items, crafting materials and eventually even a to craft an We recommend to follow the seasonal questline until you unlock the reputation system, check which rewards suit you most and then follow your regular leveling path. To learn more, The One Shot Rogue rotation is quite intricate and requires precise execution of the necessary steps. If you don't execute all of the steps properly, your damage will likely take a nosedive. So follow the 10-step guideline below to Kamehame-Ha properly. To further boost the combo, you can drink an These builds require specific Aspects, Uniques, and Affixes on your gear to perform their primary function. Only deviate from the list below after you have fully learned the intended gameplay style and strategies. Because the One Shot Rogue is a Specialized build, the obvious Mechanics or build interactions may not be clear to most first time players. Search below for the answers you need or come check me out live via the link at the top of the article for more information! Learn about the mechanical details that make the One Shot Rogue bonk. stacks damage reduction additively for each active shadow. Due to the additive stacking, each increase in the skill's rank and active shadows boosts your survivability exponentially. Multiplier is calculated based on your current health when you deal damage with the following formula: Multiplier = 100% + 50% x (current HP/Max Life) So if you have 50% HP, your multiplier would be: 100% + 50% x (50%/100%) = 125% = [x]25% is suffering from misleading tooltips as the bonus [+]OPD% you get from Health and is not shown on the tooltip. You get +1% Damage for each 1% of your Current Life that exceeds your Base Life and you get +1% Damage for each 1% of Life. That means, if you have 23200 Max Life and 7959 Base Life, you get the following total [+]OPD%: So whenever we cause an attack, with a base HP of 7959 and Max HP of 23200, we should add another [+]482.9% to our additive multiplier, which the game does not show us in the form of a number in the tooltip. So to accurately assess how much damage your attacks do, add the bottom [+]% of the tooltip to your calculation and convert your HP into [+]OPD%. Also, remember to multiply your damage with the [x]50% multiplier (presuming you are at max HP). for providing the Overpower Calculation. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. In this build we have: After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again. Reviewed by
